answers.author: Alexandra Iannolo
answers.text:
Hello,
I found some places that have begun using Form Based Zoning.
This article describes a Form Based Zoning program from Phoenix, AZ.
http://icma.org/en/Article/100155/Fiscal_Fixes#Reengineer%20Organization
You can view a sample Form Base Code from Sarasota, FL below.
http://icma.org/en/icma/knowledge_network/documents/kn/Document/301615/Form_Based_Code 
I have also included an article from the National Association of Realtors called, Making Smart Growth Possible with Form-Based Codes.
http://icma.org/en/icma/knowledge_network/documents/kn/Document/5331
City of San Antonio, Texas has created a system of Form Based Zoning.
http://icma.org/en/icma/knowledge_network/documents/kn/Document/100358
In this article you can read more about using form based zoning to make your community healthier.
http://bookstore.icma.org/freedocs/Active%20Living%20Code%20Reform.pdf
I hope these help!
Ali Iannolo
Knowledge Network Intern
aiannolo@ICMA.org

author: Timothy McLean
text: We are considering adopting a system of Form Based Zoning. I am curious to hear from administrators in other communities who have recently adopted FBZ about how the transition has gone. Has form based zoning enabled planning departments to streamline the process of site plan approval, new development, etc? Also, has it eased the workloads of planning commissions and zoning boards of appeal?
title: Form Based Zoning
